title: makime
author: makime
content: I made this little video, on how to put the odds on our side if our ledger keys gone to the washing machine.Just to save time and still be able to make some transactions.What do you think ?These video is in French version , but you can activate the english subtitle.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FEtaBnJKpgII tried to make an english version of this one , but im not sure my english is enough good hahahahttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eBOT4tZDr2kIn fact, I would also like to hear your opinion on my video series on blockchain hacking ( also in french, but subtitle is available for english ).https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZASJiIJ4z3w <= episode 1https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KnCXlCh1gk0 <= episode 2https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KaZa-Xh14BU <= episode 3episode 4 will be released soon.

comments.author: seoincorporation
comments.body: If the Ledger have been in the washing machine you could try the rice trick. It works to save phones that has been damaged with water, and if it works for phones it should work fine with a Ledger.Here is a video of how that works:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dcXugS6rXd8Personally that worked for me a couple of times with phones, but i haven't tested with a Ledger, but what the rice do is to absorb all the humidity, so, it should work fine.

comments.author: makime
comments.body: As stipulated in the video, do not put in rice, because the ledger keys have a usb-mini or usb-c connector in which the rice dust will infiltrate and risk causing charging problems later .

comments.author: BitcoinBarrel
comments.body: Quote from: makime on October 19, 2022, 04:23:57 PMAs stipulated in the video, do not put in rice, because the ledger keys have a usb-mini or usb-c connector in which the rice dust will infiltrate and risk causing charging problems later .I'm sure if you carefully place the ledger on top of the rice and close the bag it won't cause any more issues than common house dust or pocket lint would.

comments.author: Falconer
comments.body: Quote from: seoincorporation on October 19, 2022, 03:56:43 PMIf the Ledger have been in the washing machine you could try the rice trick. It works to save phones that has been damaged with water, and if it works for phones it should work fine with a Ledger.Yes, it is a helpful solution actually. I had a unique experience when I forgot to bring my raincoat when I went to the forest and didn't get shelter when it rained. All my electronic devices got wet including my cell phone and camera but rice has helped me save them from damage.This advice can also be helpful for other things that get wet for other reasons, including Ledger for example. But if it's a storage wallet, then I'd rather advise users to buy another one right away instead of using it even though rice can help them reuse (in most cases).

comments.author: Anonylz
comments.body: I have been hearing this rice trick for mobile device fell in water although I haven't found myself in the situation when I will put it into practice, I didn't know it will also work with ledger too. I will keep this in my and also try as much as possible not to have a reason to get some rice.

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: Consider putting your ledger and other small hardware wallets and usb sticks in a waterproof case so as they don't even get wet in the first place.

comments.author: makime
comments.body: Putting it in rice can help, it's true, and it was my first instinct... The problem afterwards was that there was a lot of white dust all over the connector... which blocked the charging wire... So I disassembled the ledger to clean it... I realized that it was still full of moisture inside, the rice is not everything, it's not is not magic and in addition it puts dust all over the connector. That said, the best solution is to dry the components individually.There is also the battery issue.If there was a charge in the battery... The ledger was opened several times during the washing cycle... This may have damaged the battery and the ledger is already in the terminal phase... So dry it as quickly as possible and executing the right transactions as quickly as possible is essential....The nano S have no battery, so easier to save...when i got this i had 3 nano x in my pockets....Only one had a charge, the others were completely discharged... And I was able to completely save the 2 that had no charge... time to get out what needed to get out of the.In short, the world is a multitude of possibilities, you just have to put the good odds on our side

comments.author: The Cryptovator
comments.body: If you are too careless then have to use protection. Prevention is better than cure. We aren't sure if a ledger works if you put it on the washing machine. But incidents would happen, and I don't carry Ledger always with me. It's kept in a safe place at home. Chances are too low to work after the drop in water, there are circuits inside if ledger which would damage by the battery short.

comments.author: DdmrDdmr
comments.body: This is taking money laundering a bit too literal … and what if it then went for a spin in the Mixer (tumbler) ?  Ledger themselves seem to provide little information as to how well their devices get along with water:QuoteIs Ledger Nano X waterproof?Ledger Nano X does not have a weatherproof rating. A device that has come into contact with liquid should be immediately turned off and extensively dried before trying to use it again.See: https://support.ledger.com/hc/en-us/articles/360015216913-Frequently-asked-questions?docs=trueAnd that’s about it …I wouldn’t have really expected one of these devices to make its way to the washing machine with ease, probably because my usage habits in no way should lead to that situation. Giving it a proper thought though, once can envision a bunch of situations whereby the device ends up in a pocket and subsequently takes the dip (in the water). It’s probably even more likely with the Nano X model than the Nano S or Nano S Plus models, due to the Bluetooth feature of the former, that may make it more prone to portability type needs.I’ve seen a few other videos versing on what to do if your device ends-up in the washing machine (claiming they left it in rice for a while in their case), and even one more or less stating that it was non-officially water proof (which it is not). All in all, even if one manages to recover the device, it may degrade the device and shorten its longevity. Per se one has to consider the scenario of plugging it in one day, only to find it not working, what to say if it went for a wash.Side note:I wonder how they covered the water factor in this very unfortunate promotional stunt, involving a Ledger device allegedly buried in Mt. Gox Everest.

comments.author: coolcoinz
comments.body: I have some experience with drinks spilled all over electronic devices and I can tell you that sweet drinks are the worst. If it's just water everything should be fine. I've seen flooded keyboards and phones and they were all fine after some proper treatment. Best way is to disassemble, like the OP suggests and take your time. Put it in a warm, dry place and make sure there's a good airflow. A great place to dry electronics is inside your PC case, or on top of it if you have fans blowing upwards. It worked for me countless times.

comments.author: DapanasFruit
comments.body: I think if I have a hardware wallet then I would go for a protective case...and that is why I am thinking that this should be adopted by makers of hardware wallet as part of their bundle so there is no need to be buying one separately. I am hoping this message can be able to reach manufacturers and marketers of these brands. However, I think that using the rice can be better use for smartphones and not on a Ledger.
